newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia to boost road-building outside Java.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia to boost road-building outside Java.

text.p: Indonesia will allocate two-thirds of its 1997/98 budget for the transportation sector to upgrade road infrastructure, mainly outside Java, President Suharto said in his budget address on Monday.
He said the sector, including meteorology and geophysics, would receive more than 6.8 trillion rupiah in the government budget starting from April 1.

"Around two-thirds of this budget will be used to build road infrastructure. Most of it will be for upgrading road infrastructure outside Java, which are mostly located on the eastern part of Indonesia," Suharto said.
He said there were also plans to build and rehabilitate wharves in 47 locations, 32 of them in eastern Indonesia.
The government also planned to expand 16 airports and continue construction of three "pioneer airports" in remote areas.
